intro: Peucedanum nudicaule, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale green flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Peucedanum nudicaule is not widely cultivated but is occasionally used in traditional herbal medicine.
